original: Kindström, Ernst Tonas, fd. regementsläkare, __ Halmstad, f. 22/2/81 i Bankekind, östergötl. 1., av godsäg. Ernst Jacob K. o. Emma Johnson. G. 27 m. Mabel Eckhéll. Barn: Eva f. 29, Ulla 33. — Studrex. i Linköp. 00, med. kand. 07, med. lic. 16. Stud:-resa t. Tyskl. 21-22. Fältläk :stip. 11, bat:läk. i Fik 16, v. Västergötl. reg. 17, regiläk. i Fik 26, v. Kronob. reg. 26, batiläk. v. Göta ingikår 28, regi-läk. v. Hali. reg. fr. 33. Aman. v. Karol. inst. patolog, inst. 10-11, und:-läk. v. Sabbatsb. sjukh. o. epidisjukh. i Sthlm, proviläk. i Rättvik, Gammelstad, Älvdalen o. Svärdsjö 14-15, und:-läk. v. Västerås länslas. 16-17, läk. v. telegr :v. i Vänersborg 20-26, v. Älvsb. 1. landstings privisjukh. 19-20, i Röda korsets invalàdtransp. mellan Haparanda o. Trel’1’eborig 16. Läk. v. rannsakn :-häktet i Halmistad o. v. Singeshults fångfkoloni fr. 38. Hobbies: jakt o. frske. RVO.
translated:
Kindström, Ernst Tonas, former regimental doctor, born in Halmstad on February 22, 1881, in Bankekind, Östergötland. Only son of estate owner Ernst Jacob K. and Emma Johnson. Married to Mabel Eckhéll since 1927. Children: Eva, born in 1929, and Ulla, born in 1933. 

Educated at Linköping University, where he obtained a degree in medicine in 1907 and a medical license in 1916. Studied in Germany from 1921 to 1922. Received military medical scholarships in 1911 and served as a battalion doctor in Fik in 1916, in the Västergötland Regiment in 1917, and in the Fik regiment from 1926. Also served as a battalion doctor in the Göta Engineers Corps from 1928 and in the Halmstad Regiment from 1933. Assistant at the Karolinska Institute and the Pathological Institute from 1910 to 1911. Assistant doctor at Sabbatsberg Hospital and the Epidemic Hospital in Stockholm, and also worked as a trial doctor in Rättvik, Gammelstad, Älvdalen, and Svärdsjö from 1914 to 1915. Assistant doctor in Västerås County Hospital from 1916 to 1917. Medical officer at the Telegraph Authority in Vänersborg from 1920 to 1926 and at the Red Cross Invalid Transportation between Haparanda and Trelleborg in 1916. Doctor at the investigation detention center in Halmstad and at the Singeshult prison colony from 1938. 

Hobbies: hunting and fishing. Awarded the Royal Order of Vasa (RVO).
